Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Dice \Dice\ (d[imac]s), v. i. [imp. & p. p. {Diced} (d[imac]st); p. pr. & vb. n. {Dicing}.] To play games with dice. [1913 Webster]
I . . . diced not above seven times a week. --Shak. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Dice \Dice\ (d[imac]s), v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Diced} (d[imac]st); p. pr. & vb. n. {Dicing}.] 1. (Cooking) To cut into small cubes; as, to slice and dice carrots. [PJC]
2. To ornament with squares, diamonds, or cubes. [1913 Webster]
